title: China allegedly targeting exiled Uyghurs, report reveals
description: A new report obtained exclusively by NBC News documents disturbing efforts by China to allegedly target exiled Uyghurs. The Chinese embassy says China is ruled by law and can’t be accused of “torture” against the mostly Muslim community. NBC News’ Keir Simmons spoke to one man who is being held in a Moroccan prison and wanted by China.

title: Ecuador presidential candidate assassinated two weeks before election
description: Fernando Villavicencio, a presidential candidate in Ecuador, was shot and killed just two weeks before the election. Assassins tossed a grenade as they escaped, according to the president, and at least six people are under arrest. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

title: Five Americans detained for years in Iran finally out of prison
description: Five Americans who were held for years in Iran are now finally out of prison and are temporarily being held under house arrest. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell has more details on the next steps being taken to get them back to the U.S.

title: Assassinated Ecuadorian candidate stood up to organized crime
description: Ecuadorian presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio challenged organized crime just days before he was assassinated in Quito at a campaign event.

title: What was once a safe haven for those fleeing China is now a more dangerous place
description: Uyghur Muslim rights activist who tried to escape oppression by fleeing his homeland with his family says the Chinese state followed him to Turkey and Morocco.

title: Uganda president defiant after World Bank suspends funding over LGBTQ law
description: Uganda’s President Yoweri Museveni denounced the World Bank’s decision to suspend new funding in response to a harsh anti-LGBTQ law.

title: Co-founder of Russian internet giant slams ‘barbaric’ invasion of Ukraine
description: The co-founder of Russian internet giant Yandex, Arkady Volozh, condemned what he described as Russia’s “barbaric” invasion of Ukraine.

title: Several Americans held in Iran moved to house arrest in the first step of a planned prisoner swap
description: Five U.S. citizens imprisoned in Iran have been placed under house arrest as part of a planned prisoner swap that will include Tehran gaining access to six billion dollars in blocked Iranian assets for the purchase of humanitarian aid.

title: Army deploys in Lebanese village after deadly shootout
description: Lebanese army troops deployed in a Christian village following a shootout the previous evening between residents and members of the Shiite group Hezbollah.

title: Kuwait and Lebanon move to ban 'Barbie' over gender and sexuality themes
description: “Barbie” is set to open across the Middle East, but moves by Kuwait and Lebanon to ban the film over its themes about gender and sexuality have raised questions

title: Malaysia makes owning an LGBTQ Swatch punishable by up to 3 years in jail
description: Malaysia’s government said all Swatch products that contain LGBTQ elements were banned, warning that anyone found with one could be jailed for up to 3 years.

title: Kim Jong Un fires top general and orders North Korea to step up war plans
description: HONG KONG — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un dismissed his country's top general and ordered the military to step up war preparations “in an offensive way,” state media reported Thursday.

title: Inside Britain’s only all-wheelchair dance troupe
description: Helen Mason founded Propel, Britain’s only all-wheelchair-user professional dance company, as a way to raise awareness and give opportunities to dancers with disabilities. NBC News’ Joe Fryer sat down with Mason to share how this troupe is helping breaking barriers and showing that anyone can dance

title: China lifts ban on group travel to more than 70 locations, giving a boost to travel stocks
description: China lifted a ban on group tours to more than 70 locations, giving travel and airline stocks in Asia a boost.

title: Pakistan Parliament is dissolved to hold national election
description: Pakistan’s Parliament was dissolved by the president on Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s advice late Wednesday night in preparation for a national election.

title: Presidential candidate in Ecuador fatally shot at campaign event
description: Fernando Villavicencio, an Ecuadorean presidential hopeful, was shot and killed at a campaign event in the capital city of Quito, authorities say.

title: Presidential candidate in Ecuador assassinated at campaign rally
description: QUITO — Ecuadorian presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio was shot and killed Wednesday by an unidentified gunman at a political rally in the country’s capital of Quito, President Guillermo Lasso said.
